definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Today I think my quiz is good but mum see result.
sentences.chinese: 今天我觉默书很好，不过妈妈说要看成绩。

sentences.english: The teacher mentioned that he failed a couple dictations, and thought he might have to repeat this year.
sentences.chinese: 老师说他几次默书都不合格，怕明年要留班。

sentences.english: Please select CLASS and browse Dictation Scope Records.
sentences.chinese: 请选择班别及浏览有关默书范围记录。

definition: to mark (homework, exam scripts etc)/to correct and criticize (an article)/to check/to correct/a correction (to a piece of writing)
Thousand Character Classic, 6th century poem used as a traditional reading primer
to trace over red characters (as a method of learning to write)
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
to read through to evaluate/to referee
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
lesson plan/teaching plan/a "missionary case" (a dispute over Christian missionaries during the late Qing)
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
